intro: Cassinia laevis subsp. laevis, commonly known as the silky corymbia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, silky foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, exhibiting drought tolerance. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
